Listing 7.23: Example of deﬁning an MLP that expects a ﬂattened multivariate time series as
input.
When making a prediction, the model expects three time steps for two input time series.
We can predict the next value in the output series proving the input values of:
80, 85
90, 95
100, 105
Listing 7.24: Example input sample for making a prediction beyond the end of the time series.
